name: Chocolate Cranberry Nut Balls
author: chefboy1969
summary: I'm gravitating towards the Paleo Diet so I created this high-protein and energy snack recipe out of a desire to eliminate those expensive and so-called nutritious protein bars. I don't want all of the processed carbs that are hidden in them because, quite honestly, they aren't that healthy. These are really tasty and my whole family loves them. I recommend making them fairly small and bite-sized, as they can crumble a little as you're biting into them. Freezing or refrigerating them keeps the messiness down, but they won't spoil if left at room temperature. I eat 4 or 5 with a big glass of water and feel full!
ingredients: 1 (16 ounce) jar natural peanut butter, melted
directions: Place teff in a large skillet over medium heat and toast until fragrant, 3 to 5 minutes
Stir in coconut, chia seeds, and milled flax seed
Chop walnuts, almonds, chocolate chips, dates, cranberries, and pumpkin seeds in a food processor, in batches if necessary, until finely chopped and the consistency of coarse breadcrumbs
Add nut mixture to teff mixture and mix thoroughly
Pour peanut butter and honey over nut and teff mixture; mix until evenly distributed
Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper
Roll the teff mixture into bite-size balls and arrange on baking sheets
Wrap sheets well with plastic wrap
Freeze until balls are firm, 8 hours to overnight
